snippet: Weekly applications fell 10,000 to a seasonally adjusted 278,000, while the less volatile four-week average hit its lowest level in more than 14 years.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits fell 10,000 to a seasonally adjusted 278,000; also reports that workers' productivity increased in the third quarter at a slower pace than in the previous quarter.
lead_paragraph: Weekly applications fell 10,000 to a seasonally adjusted 278,000, while the less volatile four-week average hit its lowest level in more than 14 years.

headline.main: New Jobless Claims Fall, Bolstering Hope for Hiring
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Fall, Bolstering Hope for Hiring
